children.subject: I took CS 170, CS 189, and Ling 100 (P/NP) last semester, and I felt like I maintained a good amount of free time.  If you've studied algorithms for SWE interviews and you did very well in CS 61B, I think there's a good chance that CS 170 will not take up too much of your time.  Also, CS 189 next year isn't planned to be with Sahai, so it may be less time consuming than it has been this year.  I have not taken Math 128A or CS 186, so I can't comment on them.  However, I do think that you probably won't be getting the most out of each class if you spread yourself so thinly across them.

I took Math 128A, CS 170 and CS 189 together last semester. I definitely learnt a lot and enjoyed myself, but was almost doing HW. TBH, I found Math 128A to be the hardest of the 3 purely because the material was so dry compared to 189 and 170. It is definitely a time commitment, but if you keep up with lecture and discussion, then it should be fine.
This semester's 128a is really hard. Trust me. My friend got A+ in all math classes so far, he thinks 128a is pretty hard.

history.content:
Personally I'd advise against it, the homeworks in 170 and 189 are some of the most time consuming out of any classes I've taken, and the 186 projects, while not the worst can still take up a good chunk of time. Midterm season in particular could get pretty bad too, I personally thought that 170 had the hardest midterms from any upper div CS class I've taken, and the midterms in 189 and 186 still definitely require a decent amount of studying. I also wouldn't underestimate 128A, I have yet to take a technical course at Berkeley that didn't get hard for at least a couple weeks in the semester, even if it's the same difficulty as 168, I'd say that's non-negligible. If you were to take any three of these, I think it would be fine, but if you take all four, I'd say be prepared for a lot of late nights, and very little time for breaks in between the 5th and 10th weeks of the semester. 

But that's just me, it's very possible that you'd be quicker with the material than I was, or will have a lot of free time available. Also I suppose experience matters here, This courseload would be a lot more manageable for a senior than a sophomore, I think.

If I were to take Math 128A, CS 170, 189, and 186 in the same semester (Math 128A is one of the lightest workload/difficulty UD in the Math department, for those unfamiliar; I'd say comparable to 168), how bad would it be? I'm looking to get at least a B in these courses (obviously an A would be great, but honestly B/B+ is fine with me). Is this a tough but manageable schedule, or am I just screwing myself? Thank you for your response.
history.subject: 170 + 189 in the same semester - Is it that bad?
